page.title: 04DEVELOPMENT OF WESTBURY
page.content: Westbury may be described as a small market town in an essentially agricultural area.The market, however, became extinct and the town developed light industry both inside and outside the town. On the eastern side are several firms which deal with such products as surgical beds and invalid carriages, industrial staples and optical instruments.On the western side are companies specialising in plastics, potato packaging,tyre dealers and television broadcasting equipment. On the north side there are civil engineers,national dairy pruducts and manufacturers of fire detection and time systems. On the Trowbridge Road side there are specialised engraving and machine tools manufacturers,civil engineering and the works of Blue Circle Cement.
